III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 11/04/2024, between the hours of 9pm and 11:30pm, Youth A
and Youth B were in the is dining area with other residents. They
were sitting next to each other at the same table. The dining hall
was staffed with two workers, Staff 1 and Staff 2. While everyone
was playing cards at the table, Youth B grabbed Youth A's hand
and forced her to touch his genitals (over his clothes). Youth B
then forced himself on Youth A by putting his hands down her
pants. Youth B touched Youth A's skin with his hand; but he did
not penetrate Youth A. Youth A got upset and went to her room.
Investigation Supervisor 1 was interviewed via phone on 11/8/2024. She
reported being informed of the allegations by Staff 1 and Staff 2
and had no further information.
Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
11/12/2024. He reported being informed that Staff 1 and Staff 2
were supervising Youth A and Youth B when the incident allegedly
occurred. Currently Youth A and Youth B are not allowed to sit
together, and staff are to keep eyes on them especially when in a
room together. He reported Youth A and Youth B have a history of
being abused. He reported this is a wake-up call for all staff since
they have just discharged a lot of independent youth.
Administrator reported staff need to be diligent in their supervision.
Administrator also reported there is no video surveillance of the
program because of their care of CMH youth.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
11/12/2024. He reported knowing about the allegations and being
present at the time. He reported Staff 2 was informed by Youth C
that Youth B had a vape and was sharing the vape with Youth A.
He reported Youth B entered the program the last Monday and an
inventory was completed with Youth B to make sure Youth B had
2

no contraband when entering the program. After hearing about a
vape, staff looked for evidence of a vape. Staff 1 reported looking
for clues all day and watching Youth A and Youth B more than
usual since being informed of a possible vape. He reported all the
other youth went to bed around 9:20pm and only Youth A and
Youth B were up playing cards at a table. Both Staff 1 and Staff 2
were also sitting in the same room with Staff 1 facing Youth A and
Youth B. He reported throughout the day, Youth A and Youth B
appeared to be flirting so this gave Staff 1 and Staff 2 another
reason to be more alert to Youth A and Youth B’s behaviors and
interactions. He reported Staff 2 was doing paperwork at the
counter while Staff 1 completed room checks and watched both
Youth A and Youth B as much as possible. Youth A and Youth B
were sitting a few feet apart. When Youth A and Youth B began to
whisper, Staff 1 and Staff 2 gave more attention believing Youth A
and Youth B were speaking about vaping. Staff 1 reported if
something did happen then it would have occurred when Staff 1
went down the hallway to complete room checks and Staff 2 was
doing paperwork, although, Staff 1 doesn’t believe anything
physical occurred between Youth A and Youth B. Youth A and
Youth B went to bed around 10pm and after going to bed Staff 2
was completing room checks when Youth A asked to talk with
Staff 2. Staff 2 informed Staff 1 of the information Youth A shared
with Staff 2. After hearing the information from Staff 2, Staff 1
informed Supervisor 3 who notified Supervisor 2. Staff 1 reported
Supervisor 2 came to the unit and spoke with Youth A before
speaking with Youth B. Staff 1 reported since the allegations,
Youth A has been treating Youth B poorly as if something
happened between Youth A and Youth B. He reported Youth B
denied the allegations and presented as being unaware of
something occurring.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
11/12/2024. He reported being present at the time of the alleged
allegations. He reported all the other youth went to be around
9:30pm leaving just Youth A and Youth B to be supervised. He
reported Youth A and Youth B were sitting at a table in the dining
area while he was sitting at the counter completing shift notes. He
reported he was able to observe Youth A and Youth B from his
position as he was sitting behind and to the right of Youth A.
Youth A and Youth B were playing cards when Staff 1 and Staff 2
began to whisper about a possible vape. Both Youth A and Youth
B began to whisper about something, but Staff 1 and Staff 2 were
unable to overhear what Youth A and Youth B were discussing.
Staff 2 reported Staff 1 went to complete room checks and out of
the corner of Staff 2’s eye, Staff 2 noticed Youth A and Youth B
3

shifted in their chairs. Staff 2 reported Youth A and Youth B
shifted in their chairs about 2-3 times in less than 5-minute time
frame. He reported Youth A went to bed around 9:30pm and a
couple of minutes later Youth B went to bed. He reported Youth A
came out of Youth A’s room about 15-minutes later and appeared
to have been crying. Staff 2 reported asking Youth A what was
wrong and having Youth A tell Staff 2 Youth A was not feeling ok
and doesn’t feel safe talking in the dining room. Youth A and Staff
2 walked down the hallway to Youth A’s bedroom. Staff 2 reported
standing in the doorway and not entering the bedroom while they
talked. Staff 2 reported Youth A informed Staff 2 that Youth B put
Youth B’s hand down Youth A’s pants and then made Youth A
touch Youth B’s genitals. Staff 2 reported asking Youth A when
this occurred and Youth A informed Staff 2 while Youth A and
Youth B were sitting in the dining room playing cards. Youth A
informed Staff 2 it occurred when Staff 2 looked down the hallway
and Youth A and Youth B shifted their chairs. Staff 2 reported
writing an incident report and calling Supervisor 3 who told Staff 2
to call Therapist. Staff 2 reported Supervisor 2 came to the unit
and spoke with Staff 2 before speaking with Youth A. Staff 2
reported Youth A asked to call Youth A’s sister and Supervisor 2
gave permission to allow Youth A to speak with Youth A’s sister.
Staff 2 reported Supervisor 2 spoke with Youth B who stated,
“should I be upset for someone lying about it, saying I did
something I didn’t do”. After this statement Staff 2 reported Youth
B went back to Youth B’s room. Staff 2 reported being aware of a
safety plan that involved Youth A and Youth B not being allowed
to sit next to each other in the house or in the van. Staff 2 also
reported that Supervisor 1 completed a room search of Youth B’s
room but found no vape.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed via phone on 11/12/2024. She
reported receiving a phone call from On-call Clinician who
informed her of the incident at Maple Lodge and asked her to go
to the lodge. Supervisor 2 reported finding Youth A sitting on the
couch wrapped in a blanket crying when Supervisor 2 entered the
building. She reported Youth A appeared to be “very shaken up”

A and Youth B were playing cards and sitting about a 90-degree
angle from each other. Staff 1 and Staff 2 were at the counter
completing paperwork and room checks at the time. Youth B’s
knee touched Youth A’s knee before Youth B’s hand touched
Youth A’s knee and went up her leg. Youth B then put Youth B’s
hand down Youth A’s pants and Youth B put Youth B’s fingers
inside of Youth A’s vagina. Youth A reported having no pain from
this action by Youth B. Youth B then grabbed Youth A’s hand and
4

put Youth A’s hand in Youth B’s pants making Youth A grab Youth
B’s genitals. Youth A reported to Supervisor 2 that this action
lasted a few seconds. At one time, staff (did not remember which

permission to go outside and speak with Youth A’s sister and once

Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on

Staff 2 were near the kitchen counter, approximately 8 feet away

playing cards. Youth A reported since this incident, Youth A and
Youth B are not allowed to sit next to each other.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
11/12/2024. Youth B reported being place in the program
approximately 6-days ago. Youth B denied the allegations
suggesting “staff are not stupid; they would have seen this
happen”, because Staff 1 and Staff 2 were sitting close,
supervising. Youth B reported having one hand in Youth B’s
pocket and the other hand on the table. Youth B denied Youth A
was acting differently towards Youth B since the allegations.
Therapist was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
11/12/2024. Therapist reported finding out that Youth A was telling
others at school about the incident and asking others to help take
care of Youth B. Therapist believed Youth A went into a trauma
cycle causing Youth A to experience feelings from past trauma.
Tour Observation
5

A complete tour (walkthrough) of the milieu was completed, and
the area of the allegations was also completed. This involved the
dining and kitchen areas. The table Youth A and Youth B were
sitting at was observed and it was approximately 8 to 10 feet away
from the counter at which Staff 1 and Staff 2 were located. Both
Staff 1 and Staff 2 would have a direct line of site to both Youth A
and Youth B with no obstructions in the line of sight. Staff 1 and
Staff 2 would have been close enough to overhear any
conversation by Youth A and Youth B unless, they were
whispering.
Documents Reviewed:
Pine Rest Maple South Supervision of Coed Milieu dated

Pine Rest Adolescent Residential Precaution Order dated

Analysis The agency is found in compliance based on interviews with staff,

TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
Technical assistance was offered regarding the supervision of
youth by staff. Staff need to make supervision the priority over any

Technical assistance was offered regarding the writing of the

sir_summary.summary: A special investigation was conducted following allegations that two residents, Youth A and Youth B, engaged in non-consensual sexual touching while under staff supervision in a group home dining area. The investigation found that two staff members were present and supervising at the time, but their attention was divided due to concerns about a potential vaping incident and administrative duties. Ultimately, the state concluded the facility was in compliance with staffing rules, as the staff were physically present and had a direct line of sight, and therefore no violation was established. Despite this finding, the report suggests staff supervision was inadequate as they were focused on paperwork and a secondary concern, which allowed the incident to occur unnoticed.
